\subsubsection{Dessin}
\label{\detokenize{overview/drawing:dessin}}\label{\detokenize{overview/drawing::doc}}
With LittlevGL, you don’t need to draw anything manually. Just create objects (like buttons and labels), move and change them and LittlevGL will refresh and redraw what is required.

Cependant, il peut être utile d’avoir une compréhension de base de la façon dont le dessin est effectué dans LittlevGL.

The basic concept is to not draw directly to the screen, but draw to an internal buffer first and then copy that buffer to screen when the rendering is ready. It has two main advantages:
\begin{enumerate}
\def\theenumi{\arabic{enumi}}
\def\labelenumi{\theenumi .}
\makeatletter\def\p@enumii{\p@enumi \theenumi .}\makeatother
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{Avoids flickering} while layers of the UI are drawn. For example, when drawing a \sphinxstyleemphasis{background + button + text}, each “stage” would be visible for a short time.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{It’s faster} to modify a buffer in RAM and finally write one pixel once
than read/write a display directly on each pixel access. (e.g. via a display controller with SPI interface). Hence, it’s suitable for pixels that are redrawn multiple times (e.g. background + button + text).

\end{enumerate}


\paragraph{Types de tampons}
\label{\detokenize{overview/drawing:types-de-tampons}}
As you already might learn in the {\hyperref[\detokenize{porting/display::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Porting}}}} section, there are 3 types of buffers:
\begin{enumerate}
\def\theenumi{\arabic{enumi}}
\def\labelenumi{\theenumi .}
\makeatletter\def\p@enumii{\p@enumi \theenumi .}\makeatother
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{One buffer} -  LittlevGL draws the content of the screen into a buffer and sends it to the display. The buffer can be smaller than the screen. In this case, the larger areas will be redrawn in multiple parts. If only small areas changes (e.g. button press), then only those areas will be refreshed.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{Two non-screen-sized buffers} -  having two buffers, LittlevGL can draw into one buffer while the content of the other buffer is sent to display in the background.
Le DMA ou une autre méthode doit être utilisé pour transférer les données à l’écran afin de permettre au CPU de dessiner dans le même temps.
This way, the rendering and refreshing of the display become parallel. If the buffer is smaller than the area to refresh, LittlevGL will draw the display’s content in chunks similar to the \sphinxstyleemphasis{One buffer}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{Two screen-sized buffers} -
In contrast to \sphinxstyleemphasis{Two non-screen-sized buffers}, LittlevGL will always provide the whole screen’s content, not only chunks. This way, the driver can simply change the address of the frame buffer to the buffer received from LittlevGL.
Therefore, this method works best when the MCU has an LCD/TFT interface and the frame buffer is just a location in the RAM.

\end{enumerate}


\paragraph{Mécanisme de rafraîchissement de l’écran}
\label{\detokenize{overview/drawing:mecanisme-de-rafraichissement-de-l-ecran}}\begin{enumerate}
\def\theenumi{\arabic{enumi}}
\def\labelenumi{\theenumi .}
\makeatletter\def\p@enumii{\p@enumi \theenumi .}\makeatother
\item {} 
Something happens on the GUI which requires redrawing. For example, a button has been pressed, a chart has been changed or an animation happened, etc.

\item {} 
LittlevGL saves the changed object’s old and new area into a buffer, called an \sphinxstyleemphasis{Invalid area buffer}. For optimization, in some cases, objects are not added to the buffer:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Hidden objects are not added.

\item {} 
Objects completely out of their parent are not added.

\item {} 
Areas out of the parent are cropped to the parent’s area.

\item {} 
The object on other screens are not added.

\end{itemize}

\item {} 
A chaque \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_DISP\_DEF\_REFR\_PERIOD}} (définie dans \sphinxstyleemphasis{lv\_conf.h}) :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
LittlevGL checks the invalid areas and joins the adjacent or intersecting areas.

\item {} 
Takes the first joined area, if it’s smaller than the \sphinxstyleemphasis{display buffer}, then simply draw the areas’ content to the \sphinxstyleemphasis{display buffer}. If the area doesn’t fit into the buffer, draw as many lines as possible to the \sphinxstyleemphasis{display buffer}.

\item {} 
When the area is drawn, call \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{flush\_cb}} from the display driver to refresh the display.

\item {} 
If the area was larger than the buffer, redraw the remaining parts too.

\end{itemize}

\end{enumerate}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Fait la même chose avec toutes les zones jointes.

\end{itemize}

While an area is redrawn, the library searches the most top object which covers the area to redraw, and starts to draw from that object.
For example, if a button’s label has changed, the library will see that it’s enough to draw the button under the text, and it’s not required to draw the background too.

The difference between buffer types regarding the drawing mechanism is the following:
\begin{enumerate}
\def\theenumi{\arabic{enumi}}
\def\labelenumi{\theenumi .}
\makeatletter\def\p@enumii{\p@enumi \theenumi .}\makeatother
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{One buffer} - LittlevGL needs to wait for \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_disp\_flush\_ready()}} (called at the end of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{flush\_cb}}) before starting to redraw the next part.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{Two non-screen-sized buffers} -  LittlevGL can immediately draw to the second buffer when the first is sent to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{flush\_cb}} because the flushing should be done by DMA (or similar hardware) in the background.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{Two screen-sized buffers} -  After calling \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{flush\_cb}}, the first buffer, if being displayed as frame buffer. Its content is copied to the second buffer and all the changes are drawn on top of it.

\end{enumerate}


\subsection{Types d’objet (éléments visuels)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/index:types-d-objet-elements-visuels}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/index::doc}}

\subsubsection{Objet de base (lv\_obj)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:objet-de-base-lv-obj}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj::doc}}

\paragraph{Vue d’ensemble}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:vue-densemble}}
The ‘Base Object’ implements the basic properties of an object on a screen, such as:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
coordonnées

\item {} 
objet parent

\item {} 
enfants

\item {} 
style principal

\item {} 
des attributs tels que \sphinxstyleemphasis{Clic autorisé}, \sphinxstyleemphasis{Glissé autorisé}, etc.

\end{itemize}

In object-oriented thinking, it is the base class which all other objects in LittlevGL inherit from. This, among another things, helps reduce code duplication.


\subparagraph{Coordonnées}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:coordonnees}}
The object size can be modified on individual axes with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_width(obj, new\_width)}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_height(obj, new\_height)}}, or both axes can be modified at the same time with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_size(obj, new\_width, new\_height)}}.

You can set the x and y coordinates relative to the parent with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_x(obj, new\_x)}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_y(obj, new\_y)}}, or both at the same time with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_pos(obj, new\_x, new\_y)}}.

You can align the object to another with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_align(obj, obj\_ref, LV\_ALIGN\_..., x\_shift, y\_shift)}}.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{obj}} is the object to align.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{obj\_ref}} is a reference object. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{obj}} will be aligned to it. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{obj\_ref = NULL}}, then the parent of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{obj}} will be used.

\item {} 
The third argument is the \sphinxstyleemphasis{type} of alignment. These are the possible options:
\sphinxincludegraphics{{align}.png}

The alignment types build like \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_ALIGN\_OUT\_TOP\_MID}}.

\item {} 
The last two arguments allow you to shift the object by a specified number of pixels after aligning it.

\end{itemize}

For example, to align a text below an image: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_align(text, image, LV\_ALIGN\_OUT\_BOTTOM\_MID, 0, 10)}}.Or to align a text in the middle of its parent: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_align(text, NULL, LV\_ALIGN\_CENTER, 0, 0)}}.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_align\_origo}} works similarly to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_align}} but, it aligns the center of the object rather than the top-left corner.

For example, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_align\_origo(btn, image, LV\_ALIGN\_OUT\_BOTTOM\_MID, 0, 0)}} will align the center of the button the bottom of the image.

The parameters of the alignment will be saved in the object if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_USE\_OBJ\_REALIGN}} is enabled in \sphinxstyleemphasis{lv\_conf.h}. You can then realign the objects simply by calling \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_realign(obj)}}. (It’s equivalent to calling \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_align}} again with the same parameters.)

If the alignment happened with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_align\_origo}}, then it will be used when the object is realigned.

If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_auto\_realign(obj, true)}} is used the object will be realigned automatically, if its size changes in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_width/height/size()}} functions. It’s very useful when size animations are applied to the object and the original position needs to be kept.

\sphinxstylestrong{Note that the coordinates of screens can’t be changed. Attempting to use these functions on screens will result in undefined behavior.}


\subparagraph{Parents et enfants}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:parents-et-enfants}}
You can set a new parent for an object with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_parent(obj, new\_parent)}}. To get the current parent, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_get\_parent(obj)}}.

To get the children of an object, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_get\_child(obj, child\_prev)}} (from last to first) or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_get\_child\_back(obj, child\_prev)}} (from first to last).
To get the first child, pass \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} as the second parameter and use the return value to iterate through the children. The function will return \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} if there are no more children. For example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}obj\PYGZus{}t} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{child}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{child} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}obj\PYGZus{}get\PYGZus{}child}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{parent}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{NULL}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{k}{while}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{child}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
    \PYG{c+cm}{/* Fait quelque chose avec l\PYGZsq{}\PYGZdq{}enfant\PYGZdq{} */}
    \PYG{n}{child} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}obj\PYGZus{}get\PYGZus{}child}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{parent}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{child}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_count\_children(obj)}} indique le nombre d’enfants d’un objet. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_count\_children\_recursive(obj)}} indique également le nombre d’enfants mais compte récursivement les enfants d’enfants.


\subparagraph{Ecrans}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:ecrans}}
When you have created a screen like \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_create(NULL, NULL)}}, you can load it with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_scr\_load(screen1)}}. The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_scr\_act()}} function gives you a pointer to the current screen.

Si vous avez plusieurs d’affichages, il est important de savoir que ces fonctions opèrent sur l’affichage créé en dernier ou explicitement sélectionné (avec \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_disp\_set\_default}}).

To get the screen an object is assigned to, use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_get\_screen(obj)}} function.


\subparagraph{Couches}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:couches}}
Il y a deux couches générées automatiquement :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
la couche supérieure

\item {} 
la couche système

\end{itemize}

They are independent of the screens and the same layers will be shown on every screen. The \sphinxstyleemphasis{top layer} is above every object on the screen and the \sphinxstyleemphasis{system layer} is above the \sphinxstyleemphasis{top layer} too.
You can add any pop-up windows to the \sphinxstyleemphasis{top layer} freely. But, the \sphinxstyleemphasis{system layer} is restricted to system-level things (e.g. mouse cursor will be placed here in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_indev\_set\_cursor()}}).

Les fonctions \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_layer\_top()}} et \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_layer\_sys()}} retournent un pointeur sur la couche supérieure ou la couche système.

You can bring an object to the foreground or send it to the background with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_move\_foreground(obj)}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_move\_background(obj)}}.

Read the {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/layer::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Layer overview}}}} section to learn more about layers.


\subparagraph{Style}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:style}}
The base object stores the {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/style::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Main style}}}} of the object. To set a new style, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_style(obj, \&new\_style)}} function. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} is set as style, then the object will inherit its parent’s style.

Note that, you should use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_style}} only for “Base objects”. Every other object type has its own style set function which should be used for them. For example, a button should use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btn\_set\_style()}}.

If you modify a style, which is already used by objects, in order to refresh the affected objects you can use either \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_refresh\_style(obj)}} on each object using it or to notify all objects with a given style use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_report\_style\_mod(\&style)}}. If the parameter of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_report\_style\_mod}} is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}}, all objects will be notified.

Lisez la section {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/style::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Styles}}}} pour en savoir plus sur les styles.


\subparagraph{Evènements}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:evenements}}
To set an event callback for an object, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_event\_cb(obj, event\_cb)}},

To manually send an event to an object, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_event\_send(obj, LV\_EVENT\_..., data)}}

Lisez {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Evénements}}}} pour en savoir plus sur les événements.


\subparagraph{Attributs}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:attributs}}
Certains attributs peuvent être activés/désactivés avec \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_...(obj, true/false)}} :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{hidden} -  Hide the object. It will not be drawn and will be considered by input devices as if it doesn’t exist., Its children will be hidden too.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{click} -  Allows you to click the object via input devices. If disabled, then click events are passed to the object behind this one. (E.g. {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/label::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Labels}}}} are not clickable by default)

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{top} -  If enabled then when this object or any of its children is clicked then this object comes to the foreground.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{drag} - Enable dragging (moving by an input device)

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{drag\_dir} - Enable dragging only in specific directions. Can be \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_DRAG\_DIR\_HOR/VER/ALL}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{drag\_throw} - Enable “throwing” with dragging as if the object would have momentum

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{drag\_parent} - If enabled then the object’s parent will be moved during dragging. It will look like as if the parent is dragged. Checked recursively, so can propagate to grandparents too.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{parent\_event} - Propagate the events to the parents too. Checked recursively, so can propagate to grandparents too.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{opa\_scale\_enable} - Enable opacity scaling. See the {[}\#opa-scale{]}(Opa scale) section.

\end{itemize}


\subparagraph{Echelle d’opacité}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:echelle-d-opacite}}
If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_opa\_scale\_enable(obj, true)}} is set for an object, then the object’s and all of its children’s opacity can be adjusted with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_opa\_scale(obj, LV\_OPA\_...)}}.
Les opacités enregistrées dans les styles seront modifiées par ce facteur.

C’est très utile pour estomper/révéler un objet avec des enfants en utilisant une {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/animation::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Animation}}}}.

A little bit of technical background: during the rendering process, the opacity of the object is decided by searching recursively up the object’s family tree to find the first object with opacity scaling (Opa scale) enabled.

If an object is found with an enabled \sphinxstyleemphasis{Opa scale}, then that \sphinxstyleemphasis{Opa scale} will be used by the rendered object too.

Therefore, if you want to disable the Opa scaling for an object when the parent has Opa scale, just enable Opa scaling for the object and set its value to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_OPA\_COVER}}. It will overwrite the parent’s settings.


\subparagraph{Protection}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:protection}}
There are some specific actions which happen automatically in the library.
To prevent one or more that kind of actions, you can protect the object against them. The following protections exists:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PROTECT\_NONE} Aucune protection

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PROTECT\_POS}  Empêche le positionnement automatique (p.ex. mise en page dans les {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/cont::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Conteneurs}}}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PROTECT\_FOLLOW} Empêche que l’objet soit suivi (effectue un “saut de ligne”) dans un ordre automatique (p.ex. mise en page dans les {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/cont::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Conteneurs}}}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PROTECT\_PARENT} Empêche le changement de parent automatique (p.ex. {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} déplace les enfants créés sur l’arrière-plan vers la zone de défilement)

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PROTECT\_PRESS\_LOST} Evite de perdre un appui lors d’un déplacement hors de l’objet. (P.ex. un {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/btn::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Bouton}}}} peut être relâché en dehors s’il est pressé)

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PROTECT\_CLICK\_FOCUS} Empêche la sélection automatique de l’objet s’il se trouve dans un \sphinxstyleemphasis{groupe} et que la sélection sur clic est activé.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PROTECT\_CHILD\_CHG} Désactive le signal de changement d’enfant. Utilisé en interne par la librairie

\end{itemize}

Les fonctions \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set/clear\_protect(obj, LV\_PROTECT\_...)}} active/désactive la protection. Vous pouvez également combiner les valeurs des types de protection avec \sphinxstyleemphasis{‘OU’}.


\subparagraph{Groupes}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:groupes}}
Once, an object is added to \sphinxstyleemphasis{group} with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_group\_add\_obj(group, obj)}} the object’s current group can be get with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_get\_group(obj)}}.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_is\_focused(obj)}} tells if the object is currently focused on its group or not. If the object is not added to a group, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}} will be returned.

Lisez le {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Périphériques d’entrée}}}} pour en savoir plus sur les \sphinxstyleemphasis{groupes}.


\subparagraph{Zone étendue de clic}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:zone-etendue-de-clic}}
By default, the objects can be clicked only on their coordinates, however, this area can be extended with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_ext\_click\_area(obj, left, right, top, bottom)}}.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{left/right/top/bottom}} describes how far the clickable area should extend past the default in each direction.

Cette fonctionnalité doit être activée dans \sphinxstyleemphasis{lv\_conf.h} avec \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_USE\_EXT\_CLICK\_AREA}}. Les valeurs possibles sont :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EXT\_CLICK\_AREA\_FULL} mémorise les 4 coordonnées en \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_coord\_t}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EXT\_CLICK\_AREA\_TINY} n’enregistre que les coordonnées horizontales et verticales (utilise la plus grande valeur de gauche/ droite et haut/bas) en \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{uint8\_t}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EXT\_CLICK\_AREA\_OFF} Désactive cette fonctionnalité

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:styles}}
Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_style(obj, \&style)}} to set a style for a base object.

Toutes les propriétés \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} sont utilisées. Le style par défaut pour les écrans est \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_scr}} et \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_plain\_color}} pour les objets normaux


\paragraph{Evénements}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:id1}}
Les \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Evénements génériques} sont envoyés par ce type d’objet.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Evénements}}}}.


\paragraph{Touches}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/obj:touches}}
Aucune \sphinxstyleemphasis{touche} n’est traitée par ce type d’objet.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{touches}}}}.

\subsubsection{Arc (lv\_arc)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/arc:arc-lv-arc}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/arc::doc}}

\paragraph{Vue d’ensemble}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/arc:vue-d-ensemble}}
L’objet \sphinxstyleemphasis{arc}  \sphinxstylestrong{trace un arc} entre les \sphinxstylestrong{angles de début et de fin} dans une certaine \sphinxstylestrong{épaisseur}.


\subparagraph{Angles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/arc:angles}}
To set the angles, use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_arc\_set\_angles(arc, start\_angle, end\_angle)}} function. The zero degree is at the bottom of the object and the degrees are increasing in a counter-clockwise direction.
Les angles doivent être compris dans l’intervalle {[}0;360{]}.


\subparagraph{Notes}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/arc:notes}}
Les \sphinxstylestrong{largeur et hauteur} de l’\sphinxstyleemphasis{arc} doivent être \sphinxstylestrong{identiques}.

Actuellement, l’objet \sphinxstyleemphasis{arc} \sphinxstylestrong{ne prend pas en charge l’anticrénelage}.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/arc:styles}}
To set the style of an \sphinxstyleemphasis{Arc} object, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_arc\_set\_style(arc, LV\_ARC\_STYLE\_MAIN, \&style)}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{line.rounded} - make the endpoints rounded (opacity won’t work properly if set to 1)

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{line.width} - the thickness of the arc

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{line.color} - the color of the arc.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Evénements}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/arc:evenements}}
Seuls les \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{événements génériques} sont envoyés par ce type d’objet.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{événements}}}}.


\paragraph{Touches}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/arc:touches}}
Aucune \sphinxstyleemphasis{touche} n’est traitée par ce type d’objet.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{touches}}}}.

\label{\detokenize{object-types/arc:exemple}}

\subsubsection{Barre (lv\_bar)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/bar:barre-lv-bar}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/bar::doc}}

\paragraph{Vue d’ensemble}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/bar:vue-d-ensemble}}
The ‘Bar’ objects have got two main parts:
\begin{enumerate}
\def\theenumi{\arabic{enumi}}
\def\labelenumi{\theenumi .}
\makeatletter\def\p@enumii{\p@enumi \theenumi .}\makeatother
\item {} 
a \sphinxstylestrong{background} which is the object itself.

\item {} 
an \sphinxstylestrong{indicator} which shape is similar to the background but its width/height can be adjusted.

\end{enumerate}

The orientation of the bar can be vertical or horizontal according to the width/height ratio. Logically, on horizontal bars, the indicator’s width can be changed. Similarly, on vertical bars, the indicator’s height can be changed.


\subparagraph{Valeur et intervalle}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/bar:valeur-et-intervalle}}
A new value can be set by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_bar\_set\_value(bar, new\_value, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}}.
The value is interpreted in a range (minimum and maximum values) which can be modified with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_bar\_set\_range(bar, min, max)}}.
L’intervalle par défaut est 1..100.

The new value in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_bar\_set\_value}} can be set with or without an animation depending on the last parameter (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF}}).
The time of the animation can be adjusted by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_bar\_set\_anim\_time(bar, 100)}}. The time is in milliseconds unit.


\subparagraph{Symétrique}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/bar:symetrique}}
The bar can be drawn symmetrical to zero (drawn from zero, left to right), if it’s enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_bar\_set\_sym(bar, true)}}


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/bar:styles}}
To set the style of an \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bar} object, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_bar\_set\_style(arc, LV\_BAR\_STYLE\_MAIN, \&style)}}:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BAR\_STYLE\_BG} - is a {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/obj::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Base object}}}}, therefore, it uses its style elements. Its default style is: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BAR\_STYLE\_INDIC} - is similar to the background. It uses the \sphinxstyleemphasis{left}, \sphinxstyleemphasis{right}, \sphinxstyleemphasis{top} and \sphinxstyleemphasis{bottom} paddings to keeps some space form the edges of the background. Its default style is: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty\_color}}.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Evénements}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/bar:evenements}}
Les \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{événements génériques} sont les seuls à être envoyés par ce type d’objet.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{événements}}}}.


\paragraph{Touches}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/bar:touches}}
Aucune \sphinxstyleemphasis{touche} n’est traitée par ce type d’objet.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{touches}}}}.

\subsubsection{Bouton (lv\_btn)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btn:bouton-lv-btn}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/btn::doc}}

\paragraph{Vue d’ensemble}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btn:vue-d-ensemble}}
Buttons are simple rectangle-like objects, but they change their style and state when they are pressed or released.


\subparagraph{Etats}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btn:etats}}
Les boutons peuvent prendre l’un des 5 états possibles :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTN\_STATE\_REL} - Released state

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTN\_STATE\_PR} - Pressed state

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTN\_STATE\_TGL\_REL} - Toggled released state

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTN\_STATE\_TGL\_PR} - Toggled pressed state

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTN\_STATE\_INA} - Inactive state

\end{itemize}

The state from \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{...\_REL}} to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{...\_PR}} will be changed automatically when the button is pressed or released.

L’état peut être défini par programmation avec \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btn\_set\_state(btn, LV\_BTN\_STATE\_...)}}.


\subparagraph{Bascule}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btn:bascule}}
You can configure the buttons as \sphinxstyleemphasis{toggle button} with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btn\_set\_toggle(btn, true)}}. In this case, on release, the button goes to \sphinxstyleemphasis{toggled released} state.


\subparagraph{Mise en page et adaptation}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btn:mise-en-page-et-adaptation}}
Similarly to {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/cont::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Containers}}}}, buttons also have layout and fit attributes.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btn\_set\_layout(btn, LV\_LAYOUT\_...) }}set a layout. The default is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_LAYOUT\_CENTER}}.
So, if you add a label, then it will be automatically aligned to the middle and can’t be moved with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_pos()}}.
You can disable the layout with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btn\_set\_layout(btn, LV\_LAYOUT\_OFF)}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btn\_set\_fit/fit2/fit4(btn, LV\_FIT\_..)}} permet d’adapter automatiquement la largeur et/ou la hauteur du bouton en fonction des enfants, du parent et du type d’adaptation.

\end{itemize}


\subparagraph{Effet d’encre}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btn:effet-d-encre}}
You can enable a special animation on buttons: when a button is pressed, the pressed state will be drawn in a growing circle starting from the point of pressing. It’s similar in appearance and functionality to the Material Design ripple effect.

Another way to think about it is like an ink droplet dropped into water. When the button is released, the released state will be reverted by fading. It’s like the ink is fully mixed with a lot of water and becomes invisible.

To control this animation, use the following functions:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btn\_set\_ink\_in\_time(btn, time\_ms)}} - time of circle growing.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btn\_set\_ink\_wait\_time(btn, time\_ms)}} - minim time to keep the fully covering (pressed) state.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btn\_set\_ink\_out\_time(btn, time\_ms)}} - time fade back to releases state.

\end{itemize}

Cette fonctionnalité doit être activée avec \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_BTN\_INK\_EFFECT 1}} dans \sphinxstyleemphasis{lv\_conf.h}.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btn:styles}}
A button can have 5 independent styles for the 5 states. You can set them via: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btn\_set\_style(btn, LV\_BTN\_STYLE\_..., \&style)}}. The styles use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTN\_STYLE\_REL} - style of the released state. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_rel}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTN\_STYLE\_PR} - style of the pressed state. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_pr}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTN\_STYLE\_TGL\_REL} - style of the toggled released state. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_tgl\_rel}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTN\_STYLE\_TGL\_PR} - style of the toggled pressed state. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_tgl\_pr}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTN\_STYLE\_INA} - style of the inactive state. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_ina}}.

\end{itemize}

When you create a label on a button, it’s a good practice to set the button’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.text}} properties too. Because labels have \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style = NULL}} by default, they inherit the parent’s (button) style.
Hence you don’t need to create a new style for the label.


\paragraph{Evénements}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btn:evenements}}
Outre les {[}événements génériques{]}(/overview/event.html \#evenements-generiques), les \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#evenements-speciaux}{événements spéciaux} suivants  sont envoyés par les boutons :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} - sent when the button is toggled.

\end{itemize}

Note that, the generic input device-related events (like \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_PRESSED}}) are sent in the inactive state too. You need to check the state with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btn\_get\_state(btn)}} to ignore the events from inactive buttons.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{événements}}}}.


\paragraph{Touches}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btn:touches}}
Les \sphinxstyleemphasis{touches} suivantes sont traitées par les boutons:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT/UP} - Go to toggled state if toggling is enabled.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT/DOWN} - Go to non-toggled state if toggling is enabled.

\end{itemize}

Note that, by default, the state of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_KEY\_ENTER}} is translated to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_PRESSED/PRESSING/RELEASED}} etc.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{touches}}}}.

\label{\detokenize{object-types/btn:exemple}}

\subsubsection{Matrice de boutons (lv\_btnm)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btnm:matrice-de-boutons-lv-btnm}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/btnm::doc}}

\paragraph{Vue d’ensemble}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btnm:vue-densemble}}
The Button Matrix objects can display \sphinxstylestrong{multiple buttons} in rows and columns.

The main reasons for wanting to use a button matrix instead of a container and individual button objects are:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
The button matrix is simpler to use for grid-based button layouts.

\item {} 
The button matrix consumes a lot less memory per button.

\end{itemize}


\subparagraph{Texte du bouton}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btnm:texte-du-bouton}}
There is a text on each button. To specify them a descriptor string array, called \sphinxstyleemphasis{map}, needs to be used.
The map can be set with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btnm\_set\_map(btnm, my\_map)}}.
The declaration of a map should look like \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{const char * map{[}{]} = \{"btn1", "btn2", "btn3", ""\}}}.
Notez que \sphinxstylestrong{le dernier élément doit être une chaîne vide} !

Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"\textbackslash{}n"}} in the map  to make \sphinxstylestrong{line break}. E.g. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{"btn1", "btn2", "\textbackslash{}n", "btn3", ""\}}}. Each line’s buttons have their width calculated automatically.


\subparagraph{Contrôle des boutons}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btnm:controle-des-boutons}}
The \sphinxstylestrong{buttons width} can be set relative to the other button in the same line with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btnm\_set\_btn\_width(btnm, btn\_id, width)}}
E.g. in a line with two buttons: \sphinxstyleemphasis{btnA, width = 1} and \sphinxstyleemphasis{btnB, width = 2}, \sphinxstyleemphasis{btnA} will have 33 \% width and \sphinxstyleemphasis{btnB} will have 66 \% width. It’s similar to how the \sphinxhref{https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-grow}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{flex-grow}}} property works in CSS.

In addition to width, each button can be customized with the following parameters:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTNM\_CTRL\_HIDDEN} - make a button hidden (hidden buttons still take up space in the layout, they are just not visible or clickable)

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTNM\_CTRL\_NO\_REPEAT} - disable repeating when the button is long pressed

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTNM\_CTRL\_INACTIVE} - make a button inactive

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTNM\_CTRL\_TGL\_ENABLE} - enable toggling of a button

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTNM\_CTRL\_TGL\_STATE} - set the toggle state

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTNM\_CTRL\_CLICK\_TRIG} - if 0, the button will react on press, if 1, will react on release

\end{itemize}

The set or clear a button’s control attribute, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btnm\_set\_btn\_ctrl(btnm, btn\_id, LV\_BTNM\_CTRL\_...)}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btnm\_clear\_btn\_ctrl(btnm, btn\_id, LV\_BTNM\_CTRL\_...)}} respectively. More \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_BTNM\_CTRL\_...}} values can be \sphinxstyleemphasis{Or}ed

The set/clear the same control attribute for all buttons of a button matrix, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btnm\_set\_btn\_ctrl\_all(btnm, btn\_id, LV\_BTNM\_CTRL\_...)}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btnm\_clear\_btn\_ctrl\_all(btnm, btn\_id, LV\_BTNM\_CTRL\_...)}}.

The set a control map for a button matrix (similarly to the map for the text), use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btnm\_set\_ctrl\_map(btnm, ctrl\_map)}}.
Un élément de \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ctrl\_map}} devrait ressembler à \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ctrl\_map{[}0{]} = width \textbar{} LV\_BTNM\_CTRL\_NO\_REPEAT \textbar{} LV\_BTNM\_CTRL\_TGL\_ENABLE}}. Le nombre d’éléments doit être égal au nombre de boutons (en excluant les caractères de saut de ligne).


\subparagraph{Une bascule}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btnm:une-bascule}}
The “One toggle” feature can be enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btnm\_set\_one\_toggle(btnm, true)}} to allow only one button to be toggled at once.


\subparagraph{Recolorer}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btnm:recolorer}}
The \sphinxstylestrong{texts} on the button can be \sphinxstylestrong{recolored} similarly to the recolor feature for {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/label::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Label}}}} object. To enable it, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btnm\_set\_recolor(btnm, true)}}. After that a button with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\#FF0000 Red\#}} text will be red.


\subparagraph{Notes}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btnm:notes}}
L’objet Matrice de boutons est très léger, car les boutons ne sont pas créés mais simplement dessinés à la volée.
This way, 1 button use only 8 extra bytes instead of the \textasciitilde{}100-150 byte size of a normal {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/btn::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Button}}}} object (plus the size of its container and a label for each button).

The disadvantage of this setup is that the ability to style individual buttons to be different from others is limited (aside from the toggling feature). If you require that ability, using individual buttons is very likely to be a better approach.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btnm:styles}}
The Button matrix works with 6 styles: a background and 5 button styles for each state. You can set the styles with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btnm\_set\_style(btn, LV\_BTNM\_STYLE\_..., \&style)}}.
L’arrière-plan et les boutons utilisent les propriétés \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}}. Les étiquettes utilisent les propriétés \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.text}} des styles de bouton.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTNM\_STYLE\_BG} - Background style. Uses all \sphinxstyleemphasis{style.body} properties including \sphinxstyleemphasis{padding} Default: \sphinxstyleemphasis{lv\_style\_pretty}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTNM\_STYLE\_BTN\_REL} - style of the released  buttons. Default: \sphinxstyleemphasis{lv\_style\_btn\_rel}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTNM\_STYLE\_BTN\_PR} - style of the pressed buttons. Default: \sphinxstyleemphasis{lv\_style\_btn\_pr}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTNM\_STYLE\_BTN\_TGL\_REL} - style of the toggled released  buttons. Default: \sphinxstyleemphasis{lv\_style\_btn\_tgl\_rel}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTNM\_STYLE\_BTN\_TGL\_PR} - style of the toggled pressed  buttons. Default: \sphinxstyleemphasis{lv\_style\_btn\_tgl\_pr}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_BTNM\_STYLE\_BTN\_INA} - style of the inactive  buttons. Default: \sphinxstyleemphasis{lv\_style\_btn\_ina}

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Evénements}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btnm:evenements}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/events.html\#generic-event}{Generic events}, the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the button matrices:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} - sent when the button is pressed/released or repeated after long press. The event data is set to the ID of the pressed/released button.

\end{itemize}

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{événements}}}}.


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/btnm:keys}}
Les \sphinxstyleemphasis{touches} suivantes sont traitées par les boutons :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT/UP/LEFT/RIGHT} - To navigate among the buttons to select one

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_ENTER} - To press/release the selected button

\end{itemize}

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{touches}}}}.

\subsubsection{Calendrier (lv\_calendar)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/calendar:calendrier-lv-calendar}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/calendar::doc}}

\paragraph{Vue d’ensemble}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/calendar:vue-densemble}}
L’objet calendrier est un calendrier classique qui peut :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
mettre en évidence le jour et la semaine en cours,

\item {} 
mettre en évidence les dates définies par l’utilisateur,

\item {} 
afficher le nom des jours,

\item {} 
aller au mois suivant/précédent en cliquant sur un bouton,

\item {} 
mettre en évidence le jour cliqué.

\end{itemize}

To set and get dates in the calendar, the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_calendar\_date\_t}} type is used which is a structure with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{year}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{month}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{day}} fields.


\subparagraph{Date courante}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/calendar:date-courante}}
To set the current date (today), use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_calendar\_set\_today\_date(calendar, \&today\_date)}} function.


\subparagraph{Date affichée}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/calendar:date-affichee}}
To set the shown date, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_calendar\_set\_shown\_date(calendar, \&shown\_date)}};


\subparagraph{Jours mis en évidence}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/calendar:jours-mis-en-evidence}}
The list of highlighted dates should be stored in a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_calendar\_date\_t}} array loaded by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_calendar\_set\_highlighted\_dates(calendar, \&highlighted\_dates)}}.Only the arrays pointer will be saved so the array should be a static or global variable.


\subparagraph{Nom des jours}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/calendar:nom-des-jours}}
Le nom des jours peut être spécifié avec \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_calendar\_set\_day\_names(calendar, day\_names)}} où \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{day\_names}} ressemble à \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{const char * day\_names {[}7{]} = \{ "Di", "Lu", ... \}; }}


\subparagraph{Nom des mois}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/calendar:nom-des-mois}}
Similarly to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{day\_names}}, the name of the month can be set with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_calendar\_set\_month\_names(calendar, month\_names\_array)}}.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/calendar:styles}}
You can set the styles with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_calendar\_set\_style(btn, LV\_CALENDAR\_STYLE\_..., \&style)}}.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CALENDAR\_STYLE\_BG} - Style of the background using the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{body}} properties and the style of the date numbers using the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{text}} properties. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{body.padding.left/right/bottom}} padding will be added on the edges around the date numbers.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CALENDAR\_STYLE\_HEADER} - Style of the header where the current year and month is displayed. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{body}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{text}} properties are used.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CALENDAR\_STYLE\_HEADER\_PR} - Pressed header style, used when the next/prev. month button is being pressed. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{text}} properties are used by the arrows.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CALENDAR\_STYLE\_DAY\_NAMES} - Style of the day names. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{text}} properties are used by the ‘day’ texts and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{body.padding.top}} determines the space above the day names.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CALENDAR\_STYLE\_HIGHLIGHTED\_DAYS} - \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{text}} properties are used to adjust the style of the highlights days.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CALENDAR\_STYLE\_INACTIVE\_DAYS} - \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{text}} properties are used to adjust the style of the visible days of previous/next month.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CALENDAR\_STYLE\_WEEK\_BOX} - \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{body}} properties are used to set the style of the week box.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CALENDAR\_STYLE\_TODAY\_BOX} - \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{body}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{text}} properties are used to set the style of the today box.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Evénements}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/calendar:evenements}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events}, the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the calendars:
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} est envoyé lorsque le mois en cours a changé.

In \sphinxstyleemphasis{Input device related} events, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_calendar\_get\_pressed\_date(calendar)}} tells which day is currently being pressed or return \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} if no date is pressed.


\paragraph{Touches}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/calendar:touches}}
Aucune \sphinxstyleemphasis{touche} n’est traitée par ce type d’objet.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{touches}}}}.

\subsubsection{Canvas (lv\_canvas)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/canvas:canvas-lv-canvas}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/canvas::doc}}

\paragraph{Vue d’ensemble}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/canvas:vue-densemble}}
A Canvas is like an {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/img::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Image}}}} where the user can draw anything.


\subparagraph{Tampon}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/canvas:tampon}}
The Canvas needs a buffer which stores the drawn image.
To assign a buffer to a Canvas, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_set\_buffer(canvas, buffer, width, height, LV\_IMG\_CF\_...)}}.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{buffer}} is a static buffer (not just a local variable) to hold the image of the canvas.
For example,
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{static lv\_color\_t buffer{[}LV\_CANVAS\_BUF\_SIZE\_TRUE\_COLOR(width, height){]}}}.  Les macros \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_CANVAS\_BUF\_SIZE\_...}} aident à calculer la taille du tampon pour différents formats de couleur.

The canvas supports all the built-in color formats like \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_IMG\_CF\_TRUE\_COLOR}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_IMG\_CF\_INDEXED\_2BIT}}. See the full list in the \sphinxhref{/overview/image.html\#color-formats}{Color formats} section.


\subparagraph{Palette}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/canvas:palette}}
For \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_IMG\_CF\_INDEXED\_...}} color formats, a palette needs to be initialized with  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_set\_palette(canvas, 3, LV\_COLOR\_RED)}}. It sets pixels with \sphinxstyleemphasis{index=3} to red.


\subparagraph{Dessin}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/canvas:dessin}}
To set a pixel on the canvas, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_set\_px(canvas, x, y, LV\_COLOR\_RED)}}.
With \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_IMG\_CF\_INDEXED\_...}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_IMG\_CF\_ALPHA\_...}}, the index of the color or the alpha value needs to be passed as color. E.g. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_color\_t c; c.full = 3;}}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_fill\_bg(canvas, LV\_COLOR\_BLUE)}} remplit tout le canvas en bleu.

Un tableau de pixels peut être copié sur le canvas avec \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_copy\_buf(canvas, buffer\_to\_copy, x, y, width, height)}}. Le format de couleur du tampon et du canevas doivent correspondre.

Pour dessiner sur le canvas, utilisez
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_draw\_rect(canvas, x, y, width, heigth, \&style)}},

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_draw\_text(canvas, x, y, max\_width, \&style, txt, LV\_LABEL\_ALIGN\_LEFT/CENTER/RIGTH)}},

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_draw\_img(canvas, x, y, \&img\_src, \&style)}},

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_draw\_line(canvas, point\_array, point\_cnt, \&style)}},

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_draw\_polygon(canvas, points\_array, point\_cnt, \&style)}},

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_draw\_arc(canvas, x, y, radius, start\_angle, end\_angle, \&style)}}.

\end{itemize}

Ces fonctions ne peuvent dessiner que dans des tampons \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_IMG\_CF\_TRUE\_COLOR}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_IMG\_CF\_TRUE\_COLOR\_CHROMA\_KEYED}} et \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_IMG\_CF\_TRUE\_COLOR\_ALPHA}}. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_IMG\_CF\_TRUE\_COLOR\_ALPHA}} fonctionne uniquement avec \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_COLOR\_DEPTH 32}}.


\subparagraph{Rotation}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/canvas:rotation}}
A rotated image can be added to canvas with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_rotate(canvas, \&imd\_dsc, angle, x, y, pivot\_x, pivot\_y)}}.
L’image spécifiée par \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{img\_dsc}} est transformé par rotation autour du pivot puis copiée dans le canvas aux coordonnées \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{x}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{y}}.
Instead of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{img\_dsc}}, the buffer of another canvas also can be used by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_get\_img(canvas)}}.

Notez que la rotation d’un canvas ne peut se fairesur lui-même. Vous avez besoin d’une source, image ou canevas, et d’un canvas de destination.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/canvas:styles}}
You can set the styles with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_canvas\_set\_style(btn, LV\_CANVAS\_STYLE\_MAIN, \&style)}}.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.image.color}} is used to tell the base color with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_IMG\_CF\_ALPHA\_...}} color format.


\paragraph{Evénements}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/canvas:evenements}}
Seuls les \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{événements génériques} sont envoyés par ce type d’objet.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{événements}}}}.


\paragraph{Touches}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/canvas:touches}}
Aucune \sphinxstyleemphasis{touche} n’est traitée par ce type d’objet.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{touches}}}}.

\label{\detokenize{object-types/canvas:exemple}}

\subsubsection{Case à cocher (lv\_cb)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cb:case-a-cocher-lv-cb}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/cb::doc}}

\paragraph{Vue d’ensemble}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cb:vue-densemble}}
Les objets case à cocher sont construits à partir d’un {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/btn::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{bouton}}}} en arrière-plan qui contient un second bouton (la marque) et une {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/label::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{étiquette}}}} pour créer une case à cocher classique.


\subparagraph{Texte}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cb:texte}}
Le texte peut être modifié par la fonction \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_cb\_set\_text(cb, "Nouveau texte")}}. Le texte est alloué dynamiquement.

Pour définir un texte statique utilisez \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_cb\_set\_static\_text(cb, txt)}}. De cette façon, seul un pointeur vers \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{txt}} sera sauvegardé et il ne doit pas être désalloué tant que la case à cocher existe.


\subparagraph{Cocher/décocher}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cb:cocher-decocher}}
Vous pouvez manuellement cocher/décocher la case à cocher via \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_cb\_set\_checked(cb, true/false)}}. La valeur \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} coche la case à cocher, la valeur \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}} la décoche.


\subparagraph{Désactiver}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cb:desactiver}}
Pour désactiver la case à cocher utilisez \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_cb\_set\_inactive(cb, true)}}.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cb:styles}}
Les styles de case à cocher peuvent être modifiés avec \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_cb\_set\_style(cb, LV\_CB\_STYLE\_..., \&style)}}.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CB\_STYLE\_BG}  - Style d’arrière-plan. Utilise toutes les propriétés \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}}. Le style de l’étiquette provient de \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.text}}. Défaut : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_transp}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CB\_STYLE\_BOX\_REL} - Style de la marque décochée relâchée. Utilise les propriétés \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}}. Défaut : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_rel}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CB\_STYLE\_BOX\_PR} - Style de la marque décochée pressée. Utilise les propriétés \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}}. Défaut : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_pr}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CB\_STYLE\_BOX\_TGL\_REL}  - Style de la marque cochée relâchée. Utilise les propriétés \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}}. Défaut : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_tgl\_rel}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CB\_STYLE\_BOX\_TGL\_PR} - Style de la marque cochée pressée. Utilise les propriétés \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}}. Défaut : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_tgl\_pr}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CB\_STYLE\_BOX\_INA} - Style de la marque désactivée. Utilise les propriétés \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}}. Défaut : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_ina}}

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Evénements}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cb:evenements}}
Outre les {[}événements génériques{]}(/overview/event.html \#evenements-generiques), les \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#evenements-speciaux}{événements spéciaux} suivants sont envoyés par les case à cocher :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} - Envoyé lorsque le bouton image est basculé.

\end{itemize}

Notez que les événements génériques liés au périphérique d’entrée (tels que \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_PRESSED}}) sont également envoyés dans l’état désactivé. Vous devez vérifier l’état avec \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_cb\_is\_inactive(cb)}} pour ignorer les événements des cases à cocher désactivées.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{événements}}}}.


\paragraph{Touches}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cb:touches}}
Les \sphinxstyleemphasis{touches} suivantes sont traitées par les ‘boutons’ :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT/UP} - Passe à l’état bascule pressé si le mode bascule est actif

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT/DOWN} - Passe à l’état bascule relâché si le mode bascule est actif

\end{itemize}

Notez que, comme d’habitude, l’état de \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_KEY\_ENTER}} est traduit en \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_PRESSED/PRESSING/RELEASED}} etc.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{touches}}}}.

\subsubsection{Graphique (lv\_chart)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart:graphique-lv-chart}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart::doc}}

\paragraph{Vue d’ensemble}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart:vue-densemble}}
Charts consist of the following:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
A background

\item {} 
Horizontal and vertical division lines

\item {} 
Data series, which can be represented with points, lines, columns, or filled areas.

\end{itemize}


\subparagraph{Série de données}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart:serie-de-donnees}}
You can add any number of series to the charts by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_add\_series(chart, color)}}.
It allocates data for a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_series\_t}} structure which contains the chosen \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{color}} and an array for the data points.


\subparagraph{Type de série}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart:type-de-serie}}
The following \sphinxstylestrong{data display types} exist:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CHART\_TYPE\_NONE} - Do not display any data. It can be used to hide a series.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CHART\_TYPE\_LINE} - Draw lines between the points.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CHART\_TYPE\_COL} - Draw columns.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CHART\_TYPE\_POINT} - Draw points.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CHART\_TYPE\_AREA} - Draw areas (fill the area below the lines).

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CHART\_TYPE\_VERTICAL\_LINE} - Draw only vertical lines to connect the points. Useful if the chart width is equal to the number of points, because it can redraw much faster than the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_CHART\_TYPE\_AREA}}.

\end{itemize}

Vous pouvez spécifier le type de données avec \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_type(chart, LV\_CHART\_TYPE\_...)}}. Les types peuvent être combinés par ‘OU’ (comme \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_CHART\_TYPE\_LINE \textbar{} LV\_CHART\_TYPE\_POINT}}).


\subparagraph{Modifier le données}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart:modifier-le-donnees}}
Vous avez plusieurs possibilités pour définir les données de la série :
\begin{enumerate}
\def\theenumi{\arabic{enumi}}
\def\labelenumi{\theenumi .}
\makeatletter\def\p@enumii{\p@enumi \theenumi .}\makeatother
\item {} 
Définir les valeurs manuellement dans le tableau comme \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ser1-\textgreater{}points{[}3{]} = 7}} et actualiser le graphique avec \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_refresh(chart)}}.

\item {} 
Use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_next(chart, ser, value)}}.

\item {} 
Initialiser tous les points avec une valeur donnée : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_init\_points(chart, ser, value)}}.

\item {} 
Définir tous les points à partir d’un tableau : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_points(chart, ser, value\_array)}}.

\end{enumerate}

Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_CHART\_POINT\_DEF}} as value to make the library skip drawing that point, column, or line segment.


\subparagraph{Modes de mise à jour}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart:modes-de-mise-a-jour}}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_next}} can behave in two ways depending on \sphinxstyleemphasis{update mode}:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CHART\_UPDATE\_MODE\_SHIFT} - Shift old data to the left and add the new one o the right.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CHART\_UPDATE\_MODE\_CIRCULAR} - Circularly add the new data (Like an ECG diagram).

\end{itemize}

The update mode can be changed with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_update\_mode(chart, LV\_CHART\_UPDATE\_MODE\_...)}}.


\subparagraph{Nombre de points}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart:nombre-de-points}}
Le nombre de points de la série peut être modifié par \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_point\_count(chart, point\_num)}}. La valeur par défaut est 10.


\subparagraph{Plage verticale}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart:plage-verticale}}
You can specify the minimum and maximum values in y-direction with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_range(chart, y\_min, y\_max)}}. The value of the points will be scaled proportionally. The default range is: 0..100.


\subparagraph{Quadrillage}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart:quadrillage}}
Le nombre de lignes horizontales et verticales du quadrillage peut être modifié par \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_div\_line\_count(chart, hdiv\_num, vdiv\_num)}}. Les valeurs par défaut sont 3 lignes horizontales et 5 lignes verticales.

Apparence de la série
To set the \sphinxstylestrong{line width} and \sphinxstylestrong{point radius} of the series, use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_series\_width(chart, size)}} function. The default value is 2.

The \sphinxstylestrong{opacity of the data lines} can be specified by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_series\_opa(chart, opa)}}. The default value is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_OPA\_COVER}}.

You can apply a \sphinxstylestrong{dark color fade} on the bottom of columns and points by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_series\_darking(chart, effect)}} function. The default dark level is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_OPA\_50}}.


\subparagraph{Graduation et étiquettes}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart:graduation-et-etiquettes}}
Ticks and labels beside them can be added.

\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_margin(chart, 20)}} needs to be used to add some extra space around the chart for the ticks and texts. Otherwise, you will not see them at all. You may need to adjust the number 20 depending on your requirements.}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_x\_tick\_text(chart, list\_of\_values, num\_tick\_marks, LV\_CHART\_AXIS\_...)}} définit les graduations et les textes sur l’axe des x.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list\_of\_values}} est une chaîne de textes pour les graduations délimités par des \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{'\textbackslash{}n'}} (excepté le dernier). P.ex. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{const char * list\_of\_values = "premier\textbackslash{}ndeuxième\textbackslash{}ntroisième"}}. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list\_of\_values}} peut être \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}}.
Si \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list\_of\_values}} est défini alors \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{num\_tick\_marks}} indique le nombre de graduations entre deux étiquettes.  Si \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list\_of\_values}} est \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} alors il spécifie le nombre total de graduations.

\sphinxstyleemphasis{Major tick lines} are drawn where text is placed, and \sphinxstyleemphasis{minor tick lines} are drawn elsewhere. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_x\_tick\_length(chart, major\_tick\_len, minor\_tick\_len)}} sets the length of tick lines on the x-axis.

The same functions exists for the y axis too: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_y\_tick\_text}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_y\_tick\_length}}.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart:styles}}
Vous pouvez définir les styles avec \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_chart\_set\_style(btn, LV\_CHART\_STYLE\_MAIN, \&style)}}.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{style.body} - properties set the background’s appearance.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{style.line} - properties set the division lines’ appearance.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{style.text} - properties set the axis labels’ appearance.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Evénements}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart:evenements}}
Seuls les \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{événements génériques} sont envoyés par ce type d’objet.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{événements}}}}.


\paragraph{Touches}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/chart:touches}}
Aucune \sphinxstyleemphasis{touche} n’est traitée par ce type d’objet.

Apprenez-en plus sur les {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{touches}}}}.

\subsubsection{Conteneur (lv\_cont)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cont:conteneur-lv-cont}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/cont::doc}}

\paragraph{Vue d’ensemble}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cont:vue-densemble}}
The containers are essentially a \sphinxstylestrong{basic object} with some special features.


\subparagraph{Mise en page}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cont:mise-en-page}}
Vous pouvez appliquer une mise en page aux conteneurs pour disposer automatiquement leurs enfants. L’espacement des éléments provient des propriétés \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body.padding. ... }}. Les options de mise en page possibles sont :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LAYOUT\_OFF} - Do not align the children.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LAYOUT\_CENTER} - Align children to the center in column and keep \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.inner}} space between them.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LAYOUT\_COL\_} - Align children in a left-justified column. Keep \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.left}} space on the left, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pad.top}} space on the top and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.inner}} space between the children.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LAYOUT\_COL\_M} - Align children in centered column. Keep \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.top}} space on the top and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.inner}} space between the children.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LAYOUT\_COL\_R} - Align children in a right-justified column. Keep \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.right}} space on the right, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.top}} space on the top and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.inner}} space between the children.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LAYOUT\_ROW\_T} - Align children in a top justified row. Keep \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.left}} space on the left, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.top}} space on the top and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.inner}} space between the children.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LAYOUT\_ROW\_M} - Align children in centered row. Keep \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.left}} space on the left and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.inner}} space between the children.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LAYOUT\_ROW\_B} - Align children in a bottom justified row. Keep \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.left}} space on the left, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.bottom}} space on the bottom and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.inner}} space between the children.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LAYOUT\_PRETTY} - Put as many objects as possible in a row (with at least \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.inner}} space and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.left/right}} space on the sides). Divide the space in each line equally between the children.
Conserve les espaces \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.top}} en haut et \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pad.inner}} entre les lignes,

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LAYOUT\_GRID} - Similar to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_LAYOUT\_PRETTY}} but not divide horizontal space equally just let \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.left/right}} on the edges and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.inner}} space between the elements.

\end{itemize}


\subparagraph{Autofit}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cont:autofit}}
Container have an autofit feature which can automatically change the size of the container according to its children and/or parent. The following options exist:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_FIT\_NONE} - Do not change the size automatically.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_FIT\_TIGHT} - Shrink-wrap the container around all of its children, while keeping \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.top/bottom/left/right}} space on the edges.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_FIT\_FLOOD} - Set the size to the parent’s size minus \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.top/bottom/left/right}} (from the parent’s style) space.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_FIT\_FILL} - Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_FIT\_FLOOD}} while smaller than the parent and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_FIT\_TIGHT}} when larger. It will ensure that the container is, at minimum, the size of its parent.

\end{itemize}

To set the auto fit mode for all directions, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_cont\_set\_fit(cont, LV\_FIT\_...)}}.
To use different auto fit horizontally and vertically, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_cont\_set\_fit2(cont, hor\_fit\_type, ver\_fit\_type)}}.
To use different auto fit in all 4 directions, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_cont\_set\_fit4(cont, left\_fit\_type, right\_fit\_type, top\_fit\_type, bottom\_fit\_type)}}.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cont:styles}}
You can set the styles with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_cont\_set\_style(btn, LV\_CONT\_STYLE\_MAIN, \&style)}}.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{style.body} est utilisé.

\end{itemize}

\subsubsection{Color picker (lv\_cpicker)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cpicker:color-picker-lv-cpicker}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/cpicker::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cpicker:overview}}
The \sphinxstyleemphasis{color picker} object \sphinxstylestrong{draws a color band and knob} that enable users to \sphinxstylestrong{choose a color’s hue, saturation, and/or value}.


\subparagraph{Types of color pickers}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cpicker:types-of-color-pickers}}
The color band of a \sphinxstyleemphasis{color picker} can currently be drawn in two ways:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
As a linear bar (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_CPICKER\_TYPE\_RECT}}).

\item {} 
As a circular ring (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_CPICKER\_TYPE\_DISC}}).

\end{itemize}

You can switch between these modes with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_cpicker\_set\_type(cpicker, type}}).


\subparagraph{Notes}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cpicker:notes}}
In circular mode, the \sphinxstylestrong{width and height} of the \sphinxstyleemphasis{color picker} should be the \sphinxstylestrong{same}.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cpicker:styles}}
To set the style of a \sphinxstyleemphasis{color picker} object, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_cpicker\_set\_style(cpicker, LV\_CPICKER\_STYLE\_XXX, \&style)}}. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{XXX}} can either be \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{MAIN}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{INDICATOR}}, which represent the color band and knob, respectively.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{line.width} - the thickness of the color ring (in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DISC}} mode)

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{body.{[}main/grad{]}\_color} - the background color of the color picker

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cpicker:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by color pickers:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} - sent when the color changes.

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cpicker:keys}}
No \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the object type.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.


\paragraph{Example}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/cpicker:example}}
There is no official example available for this object type yet, but here is some sample test code:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
    \PYG{k}{const} \PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}coord\PYGZus{}t} \PYG{n}{pickerSize} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{200}\PYG{p}{;}

	\PYG{c+cm}{/* Set the style of the color ring */}
    \PYG{k}{static} \PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}style\PYGZus{}t} \PYG{n}{styleMain}\PYG{p}{;}
    \PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}style\PYGZus{}copy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n}{styleMain}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}style\PYGZus{}plain}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
    \PYG{n}{styleMain}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{line}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{width} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{30}\PYG{p}{;}
	\PYG{c+cm}{/* Make the background white */}
    \PYG{n}{styleMain}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{body}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{main\PYGZus{}color} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{styleMain}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{body}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{grad\PYGZus{}color} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{LV\PYGZus{}COLOR\PYGZus{}WHITE}\PYG{p}{;}

	\PYG{c+cm}{/* Set the style of the knob */}
    \PYG{k}{static} \PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}style\PYGZus{}t} \PYG{n}{styleIndicator}\PYG{p}{;}
    \PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}style\PYGZus{}copy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n}{styleIndicator}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}style\PYGZus{}pretty}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
    \PYG{n}{styleIndicator}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{body}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{border}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{color} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{LV\PYGZus{}COLOR\PYGZus{}WHITE}\PYG{p}{;}
	\PYG{c+cm}{/* Ensure that the knob is fully opaque */}
    \PYG{n}{styleIndicator}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{body}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{opa} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{LV\PYGZus{}OPA\PYGZus{}COVER}\PYG{p}{;}
    \PYG{n}{styleIndicator}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{body}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{border}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{opa} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{LV\PYGZus{}OPA\PYGZus{}COVER}\PYG{p}{;}

    \PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}obj\PYGZus{}t} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{scr} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}scr\PYGZus{}act}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}

    \PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}obj\PYGZus{}t} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{colorPicker} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{lv\PYGZus{}cpicker\PYGZus{}create}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{scr}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{NULL}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
